Name: Jabir bin Hayyan
IC: Father of chemistry; advanced distillation, crystallization, isolated acids

Name: Muhammad bin Musa al Khwarizmi
IC: Developed algebra, algorithms, and introduced Hindu Arabic numerals

Name: Ibrahim bin Habib al Fazari
IC: Constructed astrolabes; translated Indian astronomical texts

Name: Muhammad bin Ibrahim al Fazari
IC: Built first Islamic astrolabe and celestial globes

Name: Yaqub bin Ishaq alKindi
IC: Pioneer in cryptography, optics, Medicine;Wrote over 260 books across various sciences.

Name: Sinan ibn Thabit & Ibrahim ibn Sinan
IC: Mathematics, astronomy, statics;Served as chief physician to three Abbasid caliphs; improved public health systems.

Name: Abdallah Muhammad bin Jabir al Battani
IC: Refined trigonometry and He calculated the solar year as 365 days, 5 hours, 46 minutes, and 24 seconds, which is very close to the modern accepted value.

Name: Abu Bakr Muhammad bin Zakariyya al Razi
IC: Advanced medicine; differentiated smallpox/measles; early chemistry (sulfuric acid);Worked on refraction of light and wrote about vision and lenses;Introduced ward divisions and case histories in hospitals.

Name: Abbas bin Firnas bin Wirdas al Takurini
IC: first Flight experiment from minar of masjid in cordoba; developed glass and artificial crystals ;Devices based on flowing water or sand helped measure celestial event durations, eclipse timings, and prayer schedules.

Name: Abu Hanifa Ahmad bin Dawud al Dinawari
IC: Botanist, astronomer, and historian; known for Kitab al Nabat (Book of Plants).

Name: Abu Nasr Muhammad bin Muhammad al Farabi
IC: Philosophy, logic, political science, music theory

Name: Abu al Abbas Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Kathir al Farghani
IC: Astronomy; influence on Renaissance scholars Supervised construction of a Nilometer on Rawda Island

Name: Abu Abdallah Muhammad bin Isa al Mahani
IC: Attempted geometric solutions to cubic equations;He laid foundations for solving algebraic equations using geometry, a method developed centuries later in Europe.

Name: Abu Bakr Ahmad bin Ali bin Qays al Kasdani (bin Wahshiyya)
Abu al Qasim Khalaf bin al Abbas al Zahrawi
IC: Invented surgical instruments; wrote Al Tasrif

Name: Abu Ali al Hasan bin al Hasan bin al Haytham
IC: Pioneer of optics, camera obscura, scientific method

Name: Abu Sa'id Ahmad bin Muhammad
Abu al Hasan Ali bin Abd al Rahman (bin Yunus)
IC: Developed astronomical tables and pendulum theory

Name: Abu Bakr Muhammad bin al Hasan al Karaji
IC: Algebra; operations on polynomials; hidden roots

Name: Abu Rayhan Muhammad bin Ahmad al Biruni
IC: Earth's radius, cultural studies, calendar calculations

Name: Abu Ali al Husain bin Sina
Ali bin Rizwan al Misri
Abu al Hasan al Uqlidisi
IC: Pioneered decimal fractions and arithmetic operations

Abu Mahmud Hamid bin al Khidr al Khujandi

IC: Geographer; author of Ahsan al Taqasim fi Ma’rifat al Aqalim
